channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Starbucks is so desperate for sales it’s pulling out the big guns—the pumpkin spice latte—earlier than ever before
item.description: The fall product lineup is taking on extra weight after the coffee chain jettisoned its CEO in a surprise shake-up.

item.title: U.S. job growth revised down by the most since 2009. Why this time is different
item.description: There's a lot of debate about how much signal to take from the 818,000 downward revisions to U.S. payrolls — the largest since 2009. Is it signaling r...

item.title: Homeowners are delaying DIY renovations and it’s hammering the home improvement industry
item.description: Lowe’s and Home Depot both lowered sales growth predictions as fewer shoppers commit to renovation projects.

item.title: These are the most important stocks in the U.S., according to Bank of America
item.description: Bank of America is laying out a list of what it deems to be the most important stocks in the U.S.

item.title: The U.S. dollar is weakening because some investors think Kamala Harris will win
item.description: The dollar should be relatively strong, yet it’s close to its 2024 low.

item.title: Harris allies make a pitch to CEOs that she would be good for business
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' allies in the business community have been privately lobbying CEOs at the Democratic National Convention to back her.

item.title: That huge negative revision to job growth frightened some investors but most experts aren’t worried
item.description: Yardeni Research’s Eric Wallerstein said the revision is “kind of a nothing burger.”

item.title: Microsoft will release controversial Windows Recall AI search feature to testers in October
item.description: It has been a bumpy rollout for a feature that was designed as an early example of an artificial intelligence model running locally on a Windows PC.

item.title: Investors pulled nearly $0.5 trillion in 2020’s market turbulence—then missed the rally
item.description: “If you buy high and sell low, your return will lag the buy-and-hold return.”

item.title: Fed minutes point to ‘likely’ rate cut coming in September
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its July 30-31 policy meeting.
